page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content: Doddinghurst provides a variety of housing ranging from a one-bedroom cottage, which pre-war, was the main housing in Doddinghurst, to a recently renovated 16th Century Grade 2 farm- house in Outings Lane, which is now on the market for Â£240,000. In our survey we found that{92% of {the houses were privately owned,}there are two small council estates but many of these houses have been bought by the tenants. Twice as many houses in the area are detached as semi-detached. Only the council houses are terraced.{All have {a garden.}Some roads are not supplied with gas. The majority of people have moved here from the London Boroughs, and once here, prefer to move within the village or extend their house, rather than move away.
